channel.title: [Help]How To Make Ints For custom Model[Help]
channel.description:
ok so i post here becuase i dont know here else to post...
i dont know how to find/make the model id's for a model.
Assasin creeds Penguin cape.

item.title: [Help]How To Make Ints For custom Model[Help]
item.dc:creator: @xcvxcv2 xcvxcv2
item.description:
@xcvxcv2 wrote:

[quote=“owned654321241, post:6, topic:283856”]Fighting over the internet is stupid so why dont you guys just stop.
and god, in order to add the item into your server you have to put the model in the models folder which would mean it has an id… and then just do what frost said to do.[/quote]

umm you said that you dont have a model id, simple just rename it to what you want it to be (only numbers)

and also god, not to be mean but so far all im seeing you do is leech other peoples models, try to make one of your own, for example a very basic sword. Once you make your own model alot of questions will be answered. Just follow a tutorial

Read full topic

item.title: [Help]How To Make Ints For custom Model[Help]
item.dc:creator: @frogtamer101 frogtamer101
item.description:
@frogtamer101 wrote:

Go in Class 8 (client folder) and scroll down a bit till you find some other ones that looks like the int code below past this under it. Now you should already have the wear model and the drop model from the download. Just put them in your clients model folder.

if(i == #####){ //item id class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number;//inventory/drop model class8.anInt181 = 440;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt190 = 76;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt198 = 1850;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt204 = 0;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt169 = 1;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt194 = 1;//zoom/rotation class8.anInt165 = Wield model #;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = Wield Model #;//female wearing class8.anInt175 = 29; class8.anInt197 = 87; class8.aString170 = "Item Name"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Description".getBytes(); }

Compile and go into your client and say add models or add model #### (whatever your model numbers were)

Read full topic
item.source: [Help]How To Make Ints For custom Model[Help]
